Merge pull request #80 from lonnen/feb-2020-update

travis should run on latest stable and latest LTS node release

the socket.io update moves the minimum required node version to 10, which is still older than what travis explicilty calls out as supported releases. This updates travis to track stable and LTS node

satisfy jshint lints

missed a semicolon earlier

update express

express 4.0 moved the compression middleware to an independent module so that also needed to be added. Otherwise this seemed to work without much modification. I can hardly believe it.
corresponding package-lock

update helmet

this also removes using helmet's `hidePoweredBy()` middleware in favor of directly disabling it in express. This is recommended by the latest version of Helmet in its documentation
SPDX license lint compliance

update socket.io

this comes with a few breaking changes to the api. The two that impact corsica both are around initialization.  This patch accommodates these changes by aggregating socket.io config values and initializing in one step instead of iteratively changing config params ahead of starting the server.
update es6-promise
update helmet and request

Merge pull request #70 from mozilla/update-express-3.x

update express from 3.4.x to 3.21.2, add package-lock.json

warn about fullscreen in console

Corsica client makes an optimistic attempt to initiate fullscreen without a user action. In Firefox this creates an apparently uncatchable TypeError. This fix adds a note to the console logs before the attempt is made. It also adds a few lines to the README to explain different ways of launching in a kiosk mode for managed deployments.
update express from 3.4.x to 3.21.2, add package-lock.json

Merge pull request #69 from mozilla/Querystring-Aware

Added query string capability
Update app.js
Fixed logic error in short form query string selectors

Eliminated ES6 dependencies.

This should be ES5 friendly now.  I also added short-form query string
arguments n=, d=, s=, and u=.

Added query string capability

Modified app.js  to support admin commands in the querystring:

?default=tagname  - subscribes the client to “tagname” instead of
“default”

?name=foo - change the name of the client to “foo”

?subscribe=tagname1, tagname2….  - Subscribes the client to a list of
one or tags.

?unsubscribe=tagname1, tagname2… - Unsubscribes the client to a list of
one or more tags.

use reset function for both reset and clear

Add per content timers.

If a content message has a timeout value, the timer plugin will use that
to set the new timer for affected screens. For example, the command

http://xkcd.com timeout=5

Will show xkcd for 5 seconds.

Fixes #28.
